entity1.name: time zones
entity1.description: A system of synchronizing time across a region or country to facilitate transportation and communication.;;;A timekeeping system where each location or region sets its own time based on the position of the sun, leading to inconsistencies over long distances.;;;Regions of the Earth that have adopted the same standard time, usually referred to as the local time.;;;A system of dividing the Earth into regions with uniform local times, adopted globally for consistency in timekeeping.;;;Refers to the methods and systems used by countries or organizations for maintaining time standards and synchronization.;;;A standardized time adopted by British railway companies for their schedules to ensure uniformity and coordination.;;;The practice of measuring the passage of time, often for the purpose of keeping track of hours, days, and other periods.;;;The practice of determining the time based on the position of the sun in the sky, specific to a particular location.;;;A system of dividing the Earth into 24 regions, each with a one-hour difference in mean solar time.;;;A system of dividing the Earth into regions for the purpose of standardizing timekeeping.;;;A standardized system dividing the Earth into regions with uniform legal times, usually 15 degrees of longitude wide.;;;A system for measuring and dividing time into consistent units, allowing for synchronization across different locations.;;;A method of determining the time based on the position of the sun in a specific location.;;;A system of dividing the Earth into regions for standardized timekeeping.;;;A system that divides the world into regions for standardized timekeeping.;;;A system of dividing the Earth into regions for the purpose of standardizing timekeeping, allowing for coordinated global activities and interactions.;;;Different regions around the world that observe different times based on their longitudinal position relative to Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).;;;A system of dividing the Earth into regions with uniform standard times, used to synchronize activities across vast distances.

entity20.name: Sir Sandford Fleming
entity20.description: A person who suggested dividing the world into 24 time zones.;;;A Canadian engineer who proposed the concept of time zones in the late 19th century.

entity25.name: International Meridian Conference
entity25.description: A conference held to standardize time zones and the prime meridian.;;;A conference held in 1884 to standardize time zones and the prime meridian.

entity27.description: The year in which the International Meridian Conference took place, leading to the adoption of standard time zones based on Greenwich Mean Time (GMT).
entity27.chunkid: A Brief History of Time Zones15

entity28.name: Greenwich Mean Time (GMT)
entity28.description: Greenwich Mean Time, the time at the Prime Meridian in Greenwich, London, used as a reference for global time coordination.;;;A time standard used as a reference for setting local times around the world, established at the International Meridian Conference.
entity28.chunkid: A Brief History of Time Zones17;;;A Brief History of Time Zones15

entity29.name: Greenwich Meridian
entity29.description: A meridian (line of longitude) at which longitude is defined to be 0Â°. It is used as a reference point for measuring time zones and geographical coordinates.;;;A line of longitude that is used as the reference point for measuring time zones and geographical coordinates.
entity29.chunkid: A Brief History of Time Zones16

entity30.description: The capital city of England and the United Kingdom, known for its history, culture, and landmarks such as the Greenwich Meridian.

entity38.name: Eastern
entity38.description: One of the four time zones used in the United States, covering states on the eastern coast.

entity39.name: Central
entity39.description: One of the four time zones used in the United States, located between the Eastern and Mountain time zones.

entity40.name: Mountain
entity40.description: One of the four time zones used in the United States, covering states on the Rocky Mountains area.

entity41.name: Pacific
entity41.description: One of the four time zones used in the United States, covering states on the western coast.

entity44.name: new standard
entity44.description: A recently established set of rules, guidelines, or benchmarks that other entities are aligning with in the context of timekeeping.

entity46.name: Daylight Saving Time (DST)
entity46.description: The practice of advancing clocks during summer months to extend daylight hours in the evening.;;;Daylight Saving Time, a practice of adjusting clocks forward during the warmer months to extend daylight hours.;;;Daylight Saving Time, the practice of advancing clocks by one hour during the warmer months to extend daylight hours in the evening.
